Mahagathbandhan.description: NEW DELHI: Taking a swipe at the grand alliance of opposition parties, finance minister Arun Jaitley on Friday said the 'mahagathbandhan' is a 'non-bandhan', political circus and a recipe for chaos. Several political parties, mostly traditional BJP opponents, have come together to take on the National Democratic Alliance (NDA) in the ensuing general elections beginning April 11. In a blog post, Jaitley said that over the last several months, India was "exhausted" with the talk of a 'Mahagathbandhan'. The rationale, he said, was that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and the BJP were very strong and could not be challenged by individual party. Stressing that Indians judge politicians by their merit and capacity and no longer by any traditional loyalty, he said: "We were promised a 'coalition of rivals' because India had to be saved. We were promised a common minimum agenda. Each leader amongst the aspirant Prime Ministers wanted to become a 'sutradhar' (anchor) of the alliance. He/she would periodically organise shows in his/her State and invite the entire bandwagon." In opposition camp, Jaitley said there is a tussle for leadership as already multiple candidates have made their desire clear to take over the mantle of the leadership. According to him, each one of them is interested to see the strength of the other party's contender depleting and also have high hopes in a chaotic and highly hung Parliament. "He/ she believes that only in a chaotic situation he/she has a chance," said Jaitley, who is heading the BJP's publicity division of the seven-phase Lok Sabha elections. The past track record of such governments in terms of policy, longevity and growth has to be borne in mind, he said adding their track record of corruption is equally well-known. Jaitley further said it is only because of the size of the BJP and clarity on leadership in the last coalition that a successful government was run under Prime Minister Modi. "Today you have no 'gathbandhan' let alone 'mahagathbandhan'. It is a 'non-bandhan'. You have no leader, no programme, no meeting of minds. "Stability, which is paramount, is a major casualty. The only thing in common is negative agenda 'remove one man'. It is a recipe for chaos," he said in the blog titled 'A Political Circus Called 'Mahagathbandhan'. The nominations for the first two phases of polling are over and those for the third phase are about to happen. The results will be announced on May 23. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Upper Lake clean-up begins, encroachment.description: Bhopal: With monsoon just days away from the state capital, clean-up of the Upper Lake catchment area began here on Thursday. It was led by urban development minister Jaivardhan Singh, state minister PC Sharma and Bhopal mayor Alok Sharma alongwith senior officials. The Upper Lake revitalisation plan focuses on Bairagarh and its periphery. “Next year, this kind of drive would be initiated much ahead of the monsoon,” said Singh. “Strict action must be taken to remove encroachments along the water body. Measures should be taken to prevent sewage flow into the lakes,” he added. The drive -- if taken to its conclusion -- means some harsh action needs to be taken by the Bhopal Municipal Corporation (BMC) and the district administration. Much of the catchment area of the millennia old lake has been encroached upon. The move -- beyond symbolism -- to revitalise the Upper Lake would take coordination between 12 government departments. For now, most the government departments are pitching in with their heavy machinery to dig the Upper Lake and use the soil in gardens and other locations. “The demolition drive should begin from Khanugoan,” said Alok Sharma. “If the Congress government was to initiate the drive to remove encroachments, we would support the move. Anti-encroachment drive can begin from anywhere,” said BJP MLA from Kolar, Rameshwar Sharma. A huge number of volunteers were at the Upper Lake along Bairagarh to take part in the drive. One hundred and sixty truck loads of sand was removed near Bishankhedi. BMC plans to remove 10,000 truck loads of silt from the area. *** Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhopal: 10-year-old girl electrocuted ne.description: BHOPAL: A 10-year-old girl was electrocuted when she came in contact with a live wire on her way to school. The incident was reported from Adityapuram area on Wednesday morning. Pari Tomar, a student of Gwalior’s Greenwood School, was going along with her friends when she was electrocuted. Local residents have blocked the roads in protest against the incident following which additional force has been deployed. Police have registered a case for further investigations. When footpaths become mere footnotes.description: BBHOPAL: While the city suffers with high volume of traffic, the administration's focus seems to be on a heterogeneous mix of traffic and does not include significant pedestrian movement and on-street parking problems. The number of vehicles in the city has increased almost 1.7 times - from 5.79 lakh in 2009 to 9.82 lakh in 2014. In the same context, the number of footpaths have reduced by 80%, according to traffic experts. ISBT near Habibganj and Nadra bus stand are the major bus stations in the city. All these locations have poor pedestrian walkways. It seems pedestrians have no right of way in the grand scheme of things of various development agencies in the state capital. In the garb of city beautification, the height of central verges and pedestrian walkways are being increased. According to experts, government agencies need to make roads safe and easy for pedestrians. As per Rule 11 of the Rules of the Road Regulations, 1989, pedestrians have the right of way at uncontrolled pedestrian crossings. A case in point is the increase in height of the central verge near Bittan Market. A BMC official, Vinod Shukla, explained that crossing a verge is not legal as per law. "There are demarcated zebra crossings for proper crossing of road," he said. However, urban development experts like Anil Singh indicate that traffic intersections and roads in the city are being developed in keeping with facilities for those who drive private vehicles. Urmila Matondkar.description: MUMBAI: The Congress on Friday nominated actress Urmila Matondkar and former Lok Sabha speaker Meira Kumar from Mumbai North and Bihar's Sasaram parliamentary constituencies respectively. The party renominated its sitting MP Ranjet Ranjan from Supaul in Bihar, as it released a list of another 12 candidates for the general elections. With this list, the Congress has so far nominated 305 Lok Sabha candidates. Urmila Matondkar to contest from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency on a Congress ticket.… https://t.co/JweKWNh1FN— ANI (@ANI) 1553836382000It also changed its candidate in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj by now fielding Supriya Shrinate in place of Tanushree Tripathi, the daughter of jailed politician Amarmani Tripathi, after facing widespread criticism. "The Congress central election committee has approved the candidature of Urmila Matondkar as party candidate to contest the ensuing general elections from Mumbai North parliamentary constituency in Maharashtra," a party statement said. Matondkar had joined the Congress after meeting Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday and had later said that she was "here to stay". Meira Kumar have been contesting from her Sasaram parliamentary constituency for many years but had lost in the 2014 Lok Sabha polls. Apart from Supriya Shrinate, in the list of 12 candidates released by the party, four are from Bihar and seven from Odisha. The Congress also released a list of 20 candidates for Odisha Assembly election. Mamata Banerjee.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Projecting TDP supremo and AP chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu as a “national leader of importance” and keeping the debate on the alternate front prospects in the ensuing elections alive, West Bengal chief minister and Trinamool Congress chief Mamata Banerjee appealed to people of AP to elect TDP again to keep the duo of Narendra Modi and Amit Shah away from power. “Who is Modi to ask about our Prime Minister candidate? We will decide who to elect our leader as there will be alternative for Modi,” she pointed out. Mamata said Naidu has done a lot for development of Andhra Pradesh. “It’s a necessity for AP people to give the power to Naidu again as he will play a key role in national politics and show a path of development to the entire country,” she added. Addressing a public meeting convened by TDP on Sunday, Mamata said Naidu is the leader to take the country forward. “Like he has done in Andhra Pradesh, Naidu can do a lot in Delhi,” she said. Coming down heavily on Modi, Mamata appealed the gathering to save the country and remove Modi (desh ko bachana hai to Modi ko hatao). “Modi claimed to be chaiwala after 2014 elections. Now he says he is chowkidar,” she added. “But chowkidar for whom? For those who looted the country. Modi had claimed that demonitisation would mitigate terrorism and stop black money, but ironically the number of terrorist attacks was the highest in the past two years. Under Modi’s regime, more number of farmers committed suicide and unemployment increased.” She added that Modi failed to explain the Pulawama incident and the Rafale deal and spurned the demand for an all-party meeting on the issues. “The nation does not want leaders like Narendra Modi and Amit Shah,” she asserted, and challenged Modi for an open debate on a national channel of his choice to discuss issues facing the country. AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP MLA\u2019s son \u2018threatens\u2019.description: BHOPAL: Just two days after Union minister Prahlad Patel's son was arrested for attempted murder, BJP MLA Kamal Patel's son Sudeep was held on Thursday for allegedly threatening to kill Sukhram Bamre, a Congress leader. Police took action after an audio clip went viral in which Sudeep is allegedly heard threatening and abusing Bamre, a Scheduled-Caste Congress leader, over telephone. He also allegedly used offensive words against chief minister Kamal Nath. The trigger, apparently, was Sudeep's mother's name being mentioned by Congress on social media as a beneficiary of the farm loan waiver scheme. An FIR was registered against Sudeep at Kotwali police station on April 30, and transferred to Civil Lines police station. He has been charged with criminal intimidation, obscenity, insulting the modesty of a woman, and under various sections of IT Act and ST/SC Act. Kamal Patel, a former minister, alleges the case was registered for "political benefit", and accuses Congress of targeting him. "Police declared a bounty for my son's arrest when hard-core criminals are roaming free. They are working under pressure," Patel told TOI. Police say Sudeep is accused in at least 15 cases, and faces charges of murder, attempted murder, brawl, arson, which is why he was externed from Harda and five neighbouring districts - Hoshangabad, Khandwa, Dewas, Sehore and Betul a year ago. Sudeep was vice-president of Khirkia Janpad panchayat in Harda when Kamal Patel was revenue minister in the BJP government from 2008-13. Sudeep was externed from Harda district limits by the then collector Srikant Bhanot on May 23, 2017, following a police report. This order was stayed by high court later. On Tuesday, police arrested Union minister Prahlad Patel's son Prabal in an attempt-to-murder case, following an attack that left five people injured in Narsinghpur. Delhi expert to take call on BRTS.description: Bhopal: The man, on whose recommendation Delhi’s BRTS was dismantled, will now take a call on the future of BRTS corridor in Bhopal. The final decision on the future of BRTS corridor in the state capital would be taken after an expert committee’s assessment on the matter, said urban development minister Jaivardhan Singh. According to a press release, on the request of Singh, New Delhi-based Central Road Research Institute (CRRI), senior principal scientist S Velumurugan will examine and present a report to the government in the matter. Singh and Velumurugan are expected to meet on June 25. The BRTS issue once again came to the fore when Singh on Thursday paid a visit to Bairagarh where local residents apprised the minister about the problems they are facing due to the BRTS. Bhopal’s BRTS had restricted entry for Only civic-body run public transport buses and other emergency vehicles were allowed to ply on the BRTS corridor, which was opened for other public transport vehicles including state-route buses earlier this year by the new Congress-ruled state government. However, there has been mixed response to the move. Nearly all buses from schools and colleges have not applied for operating within the BRTS. The 24-km stretch from Bairagarh to Misrod has been mildly successful. Unorganised city public transport service, still cater to more than 70% of the passenger needs. One more option for consideration for the committee, would be to look at using BRTS corridor to double for metro rail development, said sources. Overcrowded boat capsizes in Madhya Prad.description: BHOPAL/JABALPUR: An overloaded boat carrying people home from a wedding ceremony capsized off Bargi dam area in Mandla district of Madhya Pradesh, killing five people including four women and a child on Thursday morning. The incident took place at Mohgaon village located a few kilometers from the district headquarters. There were 14 people onboard; eight of them were rescued by local fishermen while one swam across to safety. A case has been registered at Tikeria police station. Cops said the boat was overloaded. Further investigations are on. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Madhya Pradesh: Man kidnapped, burnt ali.description: BHOPAL: A 30-year-old man was kidnapped by three masked man, thrashed and burnt alive by pouring petrol in Harda district of Madhya Pradesh. Deceased has been identified as Prakash Singh, a resident of Hanifabad area. Police said he was waylaid by unidentified persons on two motorcycles near his house on Wednesday morning. The accused covered his face and dragged him away from his some before setting him ablaze. While those involved escaped from the spot, Prakash ran towards his house in flames. He somehow managed to put off the fire and reached home. Locals informed police and took him to government hospital where he died after few minutes. Prakash’s brothers-in-law's role is suspected in the crime. Investigators believe Prakash had a dispute with his wife after which she went to her parents’ house. Police investigation is underway. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Yoga Day.description: The world marks the fifth edition of International Day of Yoga on June 21, 2019. Prime Minister Narendra Modi hosted the main event in Ranchi and performed yoga along with 18,000 people. It was on September 27, 2014 that PM Modi proposed a dedicated day for Yoga to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA). In 2015, the first International Day of Yoga was observed. Here's a look at different yoga styles and its growing popularity worldwide. Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Laghukatha Parv celebrates art of writin.description: Bhopal: To celebrate the art of writing Hindi short stories, a day-long festival Laghukatha Parv was organised at the Hindi Bhavan on Tuesday. Over a hundred writers and fans of Hindi short stories attended the event, which was held in three sessions. Authors Balram Agarwal, Ashok Bhatia, Subhash Neerav, Kailashchandra Pant, Devendra Deepak and Mukesh Verma participated in the sessions. The first session saw writers read some of their works. Later, a panel discussion about the past, present and future of short stories was held.In the second session, Ashok Batia chaired a discussion on ‘Balkaand’, his book of short stories for children. Jaya Arya, Satish Chandra Shrivastav, Dr Ranjana Sharma and Mahima Srivastav Verma discussed their works and released their books. Laghukatha Vrit, a special edition of the short story monthly, was also released.During the third session, Bhagirath Parihar, Ashok Jain, Ghanshyam Maithil and Varsha Chaubey were awarded for their contribution to the field of short story writing in Hindi.“Short story writing as an art form is becoming popular among the youth again. A large number of younger people participate in our sessions where we meet and talk about our writing. College students, too, are participating in these programmes,” said Kanta Roy, director of the Laghukatha Shodh Kendra, which organised the event.It was also announced that ‘Laghukatha Diwas’, an event based on short story writing in Hindi literature, will be celebrated every year on June 19. Now, bilingual books to cut dropout rate.description: BHOPAL: In order to improve literacy and reduce the dropout rate among children in tribal districts, the state education department has taken up an initiative to introduce bilingual books with Hindi and local dialects of different tribal areas so that students can understand what is being taught. The Rajya Shiksha Kendra (RSK) has collaborated with an NGO that works for education and designed the curriculum with the help of the tribal welfare department. The curriculum for class 1 and class 2 has been written in local dialects like Bhili, Baigani, Gondi and Korku for students of Bhil, Baiga, Gond and Korku tribes. As part of the pilot project, the curriculum has been implemented only in three districts of the state -- Manda, Dhindori and Khandwa. New Education Group (NEG), an NGO, conducted a survey in different areas of MP to get an idea about the need for the project. They found that in tribal districts, less than 30% students could understand, read and speak Hindi as opposed to 70% who only communicated in their local dialect. “Children of the tribal areas do not understand Hindi as their mother tongue is different. They only know the local dialects and face difficulty when they are taught in Hindi in schools. Many of them also drop out of school from class 1 and class 2 as they are unable to make sense of what is being taught. Teachers are unable to explain the meaning in their local dialect, making things more difficult. So after developing the curriculum, we also trained the teachers,” said Sandeep Tirkey, program head of NEG. Irene Cynthia J P, director of Rajya Shiksha Kendra, told TOI that the initiative had been taken to make children of tribal districts attend school and understand what is being taught, instead of dropping out. Assessment of the initiative will be done in year 2020 to gauge the impact of the programme and the changes needed. The RSK is all set to start the programme in four other districts -- Harda, Betul, Anoop-pur and Shadol -- from the new academic session. “If the new initiative makes a difference, we will expand it to more areas in the coming year. This will help children learn the state language as well as the mother tongue so that they can continue their studies further,” she said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

HC castigates SHRC for violation of ADG\.description: Bhopal/ Jabalpur: A single-judge bench of MP High Court on Wednesday quashed all the directions given by the State Human Rights Commission (SHRC) to ascertain whether father of additional director general (ADG) of police, Rajendra Mishra, was dead or alive, holding that it was in violation of his right to privacy which is as sacrosanct as right to life and liberty. Based on media reports that Mishra’s father Kulmani Mishra had died and yet his son was keeping his “lifeless” body in his house, SHRC directed the director general of police (DGP) on February 14, 2019, to find out whether death of Kulmani Mishra was natural or unnatural, whether the body was cremated and if not, what scientific steps were taken by Rajendra Mishra to preserve the body and report back to the commission within three days. The DGP replied on February 18 that the doctors of Bansal Hospital, where Mishra’s father was being treated, declared him dead but Mishra didn’t allow the police to enter his house. Then, the SHRC on February 19, 2019 directed for constitution of two teams of medical expert from allopathy and ayurvedic medicine, which shall visit Mishra’s house with a police officer of the rank not less than superintendent of police (SP) to find out whether Mishra’s father was alive. It was against these directives that Mishra and her mother had moved the high court, describing the same as violative of their right to privacy.The court of Justice Atul Sreedharan, while taking note that there has been no complaint of foul smell emanating from Mishra’s residence and a practitioner in ayurvedic medicine has presented a certificate that he was treating Mishra’s father, said, “Even if SHRC believed that Mishra’s father was no more, it had no business to intrude into his private life using agencies of the state.” “Thus, the act of the petitioner No. 2 (Rajendra Mishra), even assuming arguendo that his father is no more and he has kept the human remains in his residential premises, by itself does not become an illegality, warranting intrusive action by the State. A regime, which forbids everything save only those things that are expressly allowed, would be regarded as a bullying power-structure, while a regime which permits everything save only those things that are expressly forbidden, would be counted liberal by contrast. India falls in the latter category being a liberal democracy where a man is permitted to act in any manner he pleases, where such act is not prohibited under the law, irrespective of the fact that his act might be seen as galling by the majority”, said Justice Sreedharan.He further said “Thus, the petition succeeds, the impugned direction given by the respondent no. 2 (State Human Rights Commission) to the State is held to be violative of the right to privacy of the Petitioners and thereby violative of the fundamental right to life of the Petitioner as enshrined under Article 21 of the Constitution. Therefore, the same is quashed”.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP holds video conference for membershi.description: Bhopal: With an aim to increase party membership by 20 percent, the state BJP held a video conferencing of all the membership campaign conveners under the leadership of national convener Shivraj Singh Chouhan. The party said that people willing to join it can also obtain membership by giving a ‘missed call’. “We have named the membership drive as “Sarvsparshi BJP, Sarvavyapi BJP.” Under it, we have spoken to all the in-charge members and IT cell workers to mobilise masses to join the party. The drive would go on from July 6 to August 11 and those willing to join the saffron outfit can give a ‘missed call,” said former CM Chouhan. He said that verification of the members will be done through documents and personal contact. The new members will also have to fill a membership form. Party workers working in the two lakh ‘Shakti Kendras’ will be there to publicise and work as ‘vistarak’ during the drive, he said. BJP organisational general secretary Ramlal and IT in-charge Amit Malviya were present among other leaders. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AP BJP List 2019.description: NEW DELHI: The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), on Thursday, announced its first candidate list for the Lok Sabha elections 2019 that includes 184 candidates. The party has named two candidates from Andhra Pradesh in the first list. Kanna Lakshminarayana will contest from Narasaraopet Lok Sabha constituency while D Purandeshwari will contest from the Visakhapatnam seat. Andhra Pradesh will go to polls in a single phase on April 11. BJP's Lok Sabha first full list The Lok Sabha elections will be held in seven phases from April 11 to May 19, 2019. The counting of the votes has been scheduled for May 23. The first phase will be held on April 11, second on April 18, third on April 23 and fourth on April 29, fifth on May 6, sixth on May 12 and seventh phase on May 19. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will contest from Varanasi constituency, while BJP president Amit Shah will fight from Gandhinagar in place of L K Advani. As many as 90 crore electors, including 1.59 crore new voters aged 18-19 years, are registered to vote in the upcoming general election. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nCitizens enjoy Zumba workshop during R.description: Week after week, people from across age groups gather for the Raahgiri celebrations — exercising, walking and dancing their way to good health. And this week was no different.  While throngs of youngsters as always attended the Zumba workshop, it was heartening to see an increasing number of older people also making their way for the dance session. Burning calories by grooving to peppy numbers seem to be attracting more and more Bhopalites to come for these rigorous sessions. A lot of guests could also be seen walking next to the lake. Page breaks 10-year-old 400m national re.description: Bhopal: MP’s swimmer Advait Page continued his splash in the pool. On the second day of the Singapore national championship, Page broke 10-year-old national record set by former Olympian and Arjuna awardee Rehan Pocha in the men’s 400m individual medley (IM), by clocking 4:27.94. Poncha had set the national record clocking 4:29.89. Contesting in the event, Advait won silver medal. This was his second medal in the championship. Pang Shen Jun of Singapore won gold clocking timing of 4:26.69 while Soon Sebastian won third position with timing of 4:28.36. The 400 IM is an event that tests both versatility and endurance. Each swimmer is required to swim the four strokes each for 100m in the order: butterfly, backstroke, breaststroke and freestyle. Incidentally, Page has already achieved B-qualification for the 2020 Tokyo Olympics after setting national record in the same championship on Wednesday. The Indore lad had clocked 8.00.76 in 800m freestyle category at the Singapore National Championships. The B-timing for men’s 800m freestyle for Tokyo Olympics is 8.08.54 while the A-qualification is 7.54.31. Advait has also improved his B-qualification. Last year, during the Asian Games, he had secured B qualification with a timing of 8.09.17. Congratulating Page, president of MP Swimming Association Piyush Sharma said, “We are confident that he will achieve the A qualification mark for Olympics. Page has been a consistent swimmer for past couple of years and has made his strong presence felt in the international circuit in such short span of time.” For the 18-year-old, 2019 has begun on a thumping note after a glory-studded 2018. He completed a hat-trick of gold medals in the senior category at the 72nd Senior National Aquatics Championship held in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala, in 2018. He won gold in the 800, 1500m and 400m categories, setting a championship record in the former. The season has just begun and Advait is already making waves. The efforts of 10 years have started paying dividends for the promising swimmer. He burst into the international circuit at the age of 15, and qualified for the 2018 Summer Youth Olympics. Advait, who took to swimming at the age of six, credits his father Ashutosh Page and school coach Abhilash MT for encouraging him and helping him reach where he has. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ex-Armyman shoots at his daughter for re.description: BHOPAL: An ex-Armyman allegedly tried to rape his 21-year-old daughter in Gwalior district on Monday night and shot her when she resisted. She is in hospital and out of danger. The accused, who retired as a naib subedar, was drunk when he tried to force himself on her, says her complaint. She says she was asleep when her father, a 49-year-old, entered her room and tried to rape her. Shocked, she pushed him away and ran into her mother’s room. Furious at being rebuffed, the ex-Armyman took out his licensed 12-bore gun and fired two shots. Some of the pellets hit his daughter. The other shot missed. Her mother shouted for help and neighbours came running, already alerted by the gunshots. They overpowered and disarmed him and called police. Gwalior SP Navneet Bhasin said, “We have arrested the accused and seized his gun. The girl is out of danger now.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nPriyanka Chopra, Prakash Jha address t.description: A couple of days before the shooting of Prakash Jha’s Gangaajal 2 wrapped up, the film’s cast got together to interact with the media in the city.  Addressing the crowd, Priyanka Chopra, who plays a tough cop in the film, said, “I will miss Bhopal a lot and having spent a month here, I have fallen in love with the place. The people here are very cooperative and it has been a memorable shooting experience here.”  Besides Chopra, the other actors, including Rahut Bhat, Murli Sharma and Manav Kaul, were also present. Praising the beauty and the cooperation received by them, Jha said, “Bhopal is a place where shooting can be done with ease and the credit goes to the audience here.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Madhya Pradesh: 10-year-old girl electro.description: BHOPAL: A 10-year-old girl was killed when she came in contact with a live wire on way to school. Incident was reported from Adityapuram area on Wednesday morning.  Pari Tomar was going along with her friends when she got electrocuted. She was a Class 4 student of Gwalior’s Greenwood school. Local residents have blocked roads in protest against the incident. The additional force has been deployed. Police have registered a case for further investigations. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhopal youth dies after \u2018assault\u2.description: BHOPAL: A 26-year-old property dealer died after allegedly being beaten by police in the wee hours of Wednesday following an accident in the BRTS corridor in Bairagarh. Five policemen, including an SHO and an SI, have been suspended. During the alleged assault, the victim, Shivam Mishra, kept pleading that he had acute chest pain and needed to go to hospital, but the policemen didn’t relent, says his friend Govind Sharma Podel, who, too, claims to have been beaten in custody. Both Shivam and Govind are sons of police officers. Shivam’s family alleges they were not informed about his death. They refused to let the body be taken for autopsy until the accused cops were booked for murder and loot. They say a gold chain and ring that Shivam wore, his wallet and his mobile phone are missing. “Orders of judicial inquiry into the death of Shivam Mishra have been issued. There will be a fair investigation. Whoever is found responsible will not be spared. Justice will be done to the family,” tweeted chief minister Kamal Nath“A judicial inquiry has been ordered. Anyone found guilty will not be spared. There will be strong action,” DGP V K Singh told TOI. The autopsy report says Shivam died of cardiac arrest and that the other injuries were trivial in nature, said IG Yogesh Deshmukh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

E-tendering scam: EOW summons two ex-sec.description: BHOPAL: Madhya Pradesh state economic offences wing on Tuesday summoned two government officers, who were secretaries to former BJP minister Narottam Mishra, for questioning in connection with the probe into the alleged Rs 80,000 cr e-tendering scam. Notices have been issued to Nirmal Awasthi and Virendra Pandey, who were on deputation from water resources department and law department to Mishra's office. Sources in the agency said they will be questioned in connection with a tender awarded to Gujarat-based Sorathia Velji Ratna & Co in 2018. Sources say Awasthi went to the EOW office on Wednesday to have his statement recorded. The water resources department had floated a Rs 116-crore tender for a project that the firm bagged for Rs 113 crore, and when the letter of acceptance was given, the amount was reduced to Rs 105 crore, say sources. EOW investigation to focus on rates, tendering procedureFirst of all, the tender went at a low rate and then there was further reduction of around Rs 8 crore. We want to know the reason for the modification in rates and investigate the tendering procedures,” said an EOW official. Sorathia Velji Ratna & Co, a company registered in Vadodara, was granted a 30-day ‘transit temporary anticipatory bail’ from Gujarat high court, following a joint petition moved by 10 people associated with the firm. The bail period ended a couple of days ago and EOW officials are trying to arrest those named in their FIR, say sources. The petitioners — Meghli Velji Sorathia, Ashok Velji Bambhaniya, Diwaliben Sorathia, Bharat Sorathia, Chandresh Sorathia, Mahesh Sorathia, Haresh Sorathia, Paresh Sorathia, Manoj Vasava and Raju Gehani — had informed the court that they apprehended arrest in connection with the FIR registered by EOW in Bhopal and sought bail, said sources. Abduction Arun.description: Bhopal: A 29-year-old businessman was allegedly abducted and robbed by his three servants and two unidentified man on the wee hours of Wednesday in Hanumanganj locality. After the abduction, victim somehow manages to escape from their clutches and approached police. Hanumanganj police registered a case and detained the accused. Investigating Officer SI Praveen Thakre said that the complainant Salman Khan, who runs a car accessories shop in Hamidia road, alleged in his complaint that on Wednesday around 12.30 am, after closing his shop when he asked his workers to come outside the shop, the servants told him that a short-circuit occurred inside the shop. SI Thakre said when he went inside to check the short-circuit, accused Salman, Sameer, Yaman allegedly grabbed him from behind in the dark. When he resisted they snuffed him cloth laced with sedatives and glued his mouth, so he could not raise alarm for help. “The accused robbed cash Rs. 1.30 lakh from his possession and took him inside the four-wheeler. Around 3 pm when he came into his senses he found that he was in the back seat in the car and two unidentified accused was driving the car towards Bhanpur area,” said SI Thakre. He added that victim somehow manage to jump off from the moving car near Chhola locality. When the accused found that locals rushed for help they fled the spot. Victim had manage to note down the registration number of thevehicle used in abduction. SI Thakre said immediately he rushed to Nadra bus stand and informed the family members about the incident and lodged a complaint. A case has been registered under various sections of IPC and police detained the accused. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. Here is a list of contituencies with prominent candiadates or clashes. Now, tracking devices, panic buttons in.description: BHOPAL: The state government is planning to install tracking devices and panic buttons in all commercial passenger vehicles in a bid to ensure the safety of passengers, especially women. State transport Minister Govind Rajput on Wednesday said a GPS-based control-cum-command centre would be set up in the state capital to track the real time location of commercial vehicles. “We are planning to introduce GPS-based tracking devices and panic (emergency) buttons in all commercial passenger vehicles including buses and taxis,” the minister told a press conference. Rajput said a GPS based control-cum-command centre would also be set up in the state capital to know the real time location of commercial vehicles. “The panic buttons for emergency situations will be installed in the commercial passenger vehicles. If pressed, these panic buttons will send signals to the command centre so that help can be extended quickly. The move is aimed at ensuring the safety of passengers, especially women,” he said. The minister also said that a test driving track would be set up at every divisional headquarters under the Public-Private Partnership (PPP) model. Rajput said the transport department had issued 25,000 driving licenses to girls for free till February this year by holding camps in college campuses. The state government also announced to provide Rs5000 as minimum compensation to the small and marginal farmers in the event of crop loss due to natural calamities. He added that the state government had initiated a process to take back about 1000 acres of vacant land lying unused on the Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited (BHEL) campus in Bhopal. The government has written a letter to Union Ministry of Heavy Industries and Public Enterprises in this regard, said minister Rajput. “The land was allotted to BHEL at the time of its inception but it is still lying unused,” Rajput said about the purpose behind reclaiming the land. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Woman jumps into fire to save house from.description: BHOPAL: A 50-year-old woman made for herself a pyre and jumped into the flames to protest an anti-encroachment drive by the administration in Morena, Madhya Pradesh. She is battling for life with 50% burns. Locals set fire to a JCB machine and wrecked the tehsildar’s car in the violence that followed. The district administration had sent a team to raze the house of Ram Avatar in Ganpat Ka Pura village of Morena as it allegedly encroached upon land of a temple trust, said sources. The demolition team, led by a tehsildar, arrived with a JCB machine. The team faced resistance as soon as they arrived. Ram Avatar’s wife Rajabeti piled up a stack of hay, set it on fire and before anyone could stop her, jumped into it. Violence broke out immediately. A mob damaged the tehsildar’s vehicle, torched the JCB and attacked firemen who were trying to put out both fires. In the melee, officials rescued the badly burned woman and admitted her to hospital. Locals blocked Ambah-Porsa Road, and it took a lot of persuasion by senior officials to get them disperse. Morena SP Asit Yadav said, “The situation is completely under control. The blockade has been removed and road opened. The injured woman had been admitted at hospital where her treatment is underway.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Custody of children of person accused of.description: Bhopal/Jabalpur: A single-judge bench of MP high court ordered handing over children of a person, accused of killing his wife, to their paternal grandparents as desired by the child’s father, who is in jail under judicial custody. The children had been taken away by their maternal grandparents to Bihar after the alleged murder of their mother by the father. The court suggested that father being the only natural guardian of the child in the absence of mother was entitled to take a decision as to where his son should stay. Paternal grandparents, Bhramarkant Jha and his wife, residents of Anuppur district in MP, had filed a habeas corpus petition after their grand son and grand daughter, aged eight and six years respectively, were taken away by his maternal grandparents to Sihersa in Bihar after their father allegedly shot dead his wife and wife of his brother at his house in Anuppur. Now, he is in jail under judicial custody. In their habeas corpus petition, Bharamkant and his wife said that their son, Nirmal Jha, is accused of murder of his wife Pooja and wife of his brother, Archana on August 5, 2018. After his arrest, Pooja’s parents, Indra Kumar Jha and Sudha Jha, came down from Bihar and took the children with them. They said that their son wished that the children stayed with their paternal grandparents and prayed the court to handover custody of the children to them. The court in response to their petition had directed Anuppur police to produce the children and their maternal grandparents in the court. After they were produced in the court on Tuesday, Justice Atul Sreedharan in his brief order said “pursuant to the orders passed on April 30, 2019, the children have been produced before this court by Indra Kumar Jha and Sunila Jha, who are the maternal grandparents of the children. They have been requested to handover the children to Bhramarkant Jha, who is the paternal grandfather of the children. It is relevant to state here that the father of these children, who is presently in judicial custody, had desired that his children be with his parents on the basis of which Bhramarkant Jha filed this writ petition for habeas corpus. The children had been taken away to Sahersa in Bihar by Indra Kumar Jha and Sunila Jha. But, as stated herein above, they have produced the corpus before this court. They are also handing over the custody of the corpus to the petitioners today in the presence of the court. ASI Pramod Verma, Bhalumada, district Anuppur, is present before this court. His further presence is discharged. In view of the same, the purpose of the petition has been served and the same is disposed of as such.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BSP List 2019 UP.description: LUCKNOW: The BSP on Friday announced its first list of 11 candidates for the Lok Sabha elections 2019, fielding JD(S) turncoat Kunwar Danish Ali from Amroha. Ali, who was general secretary of the Janata Dal-Secular, quit the party and joined the Bahujan Samaj Party only last week. The BSP also declared Haji Fazulrahman its nominee from Saharanpur, Malook Nagar from Bijnore and Girish Chandra from Nagina, a party release said. Hazi Mohammad Yakoob has been fielded from Meerut, Satbeer Nagar from Gautam Buddh Nagar, Yogesh Verma from Bulandshahr, Ajit Baliyan from Aligarh, Manoj Kumar Soni from Agra, Rajveer Singh from Fatehpur Sikri and Ruchi Veera from Aonla. Mayawati's BSP is contesting 38 of the 80 Lok Sabha constituencies in Uttar Pradesh under the seat-sharing arrangement with Samajwadi Party and the Rashtriya Lok Dal. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Rahul Gandhi.description: NEW DELHI: Strongly indicating that he does not intend to review his decision to step down as Congress president after the party's Lok Sabha debacle, Rahul Gandhi on Thursday said the party would decide on his successor and he would keep himself aloof from the process. Asked by the media in the Parliament complex about his possible successor, Rahul crucially did not parry the question but answered that he was not the person to decide on the issue and that it was a task for the party. After weeks of anonymous claims, this was the first confirmation of his intent to quit as the AICC chief ever since he announced the decision at a closed-door meeting of the Congress Working Committee (CWC) on May 25. While the apex body turned down the resignation, Congress insiders said that Rahul is insistent on leaving the top job and had rebuffed all attempts to persuade him to stay on. Lok Sabha poll fallout: Congress considers naming interim presidentEven before Rahul publicly declared his intent, there were indications that Congress was considering naming a working president or interim president at the head of a "collegium" of leaders. Names of veterans like Mallikarjun Kharge, Sushilkumar Shinde, Ashok Gehlot, Mukul Wasnik and Prithviraj Chavan have done the rounds as likely candidates. Rahul's insistence that no one from the Gandhi family should hold the post effectively rules out sister Priyanka. Take charge, douse fire in Cong: Moily tells Rahul GandhiRahul's brief remark comes at a time when the party is caught in a bitter blame-game with its data department under Praveen Chakraborty in the crossfire for "misleading" the leadership on the trends in the Lok Sabha elections. The attack has been sharp with allegations that the data itself was not reliable with Chakraborty's proximity to Rahul raising the question whether the "feedback" only served to strengthen the leader's inclination to target PM Narendra Modi's image. Meanwhile, Rahul met Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel along with AICC state in-charge P L Punia for a political discussion on Thursday evening. Party leaders attach importance to the meeting given that he has been reluctant to interact with colleagues lately. However, Rahul's public attestation about quitting may make it difficult for AICC managers to sway his thinking. As it became apparent that he might actually refuse to relent, various proposals have been mooted to make decision-making a collective affair through a "collegium" so that Rahul returns to active presidency. There have also been suggestions that a working president could be appointed. The proposal for a collegium is rooted in Rahul's complaint that he has been working alone and the party leaders did not pull their weight behind him in the LS polls. He had aired his grievances at the now-famous CWC brainstorming called after the party failed to improve its performance, going from 44 to 52. However, Congress leaders said they would continue to make efforts to persuade Rahul. Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot told TOI, "Rahul has to remain the Congress president. He worked hard and fearlessly. Victory and defeat are part of polls." Gehlot warned if Rahul quits, Congress workers would either become inactive or leave the party.Sources say Rahul is hell-bent on quitting and has made it clear that none from the Gandhi family should be put at the helm of the Congress organisation. In Video:Won't decide who will be the next president of Congress: Rahul GandhiDownload The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Tamil Nadu Elections.description: Voting for Lok Sabha elections 2019 in Tamil Nadu will take place in a single phase on April 18 as per the notification issued by the Election Commission of India. Out of the 39 seats in the state, seven Lok Sabha seats are reserved for SC. Bride turns away baraat because groom wa.description: JABALPUR: A baraat in Jabalpur had to take a U-turn, after the bride refused to marry on finding the groom to be drunk. The woman’s refusal triggered tension between both sides of the family, and police had to intervene to settle the issue. The situation was such, that the bride’s family had kept the baraatis hostage. Patan police station in charge, Shivraj Singh Chauhan said, “Marriage of a Jabalpur woman and a Sagar man was being held at Nunsar on Sunday.” Police withheld the names of the bride and groom to protect the identity of the family. “During the initial greeting ceremony, the bride’s family found that the groom was drunk. When they confronted his family, they said, he does not consume alcohol. The bride refused to marry the drunk groom.” “Soon after a dispute broke out over returning the gifts exchanged between them. The bride’s family held the baraati hostage. Police contained the situation and an agreement was reached, after which the baarat returned to Sagar,” he said. “I am happy with my daughter’s decision. She has a master's degree in engineering. We cannot put her through hell,” the woman’s father told TOI. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

MP govt cuts collector rates by 20% to b.description: BHOPAL: In a bid to give fillip to the real estate and construction sector, the state cabinet headed by chief minister Kamal Nath on Wednesday decided to slash the collector guideline rates of property to 20%. To compensate the loss, the government decided to increase stamp duty on the registration of property from 7.3% to 9.5% across the state and from 10.3% to 12.5% in select urban areas. "The decision to reduce the collector guideline was taken in view of recession in the real estate sector. Providing support to the real estate would help in employment generation, besides giving boost to related sectors which in turn will kick-start the state’s economy. The decision would be effective after the official notification", state law and public relations minister PC Sharma told reporters after the cabinet meeting. Sharma said the decision would help property buyers to pay actual income tax incurred on the transactions. Earlier, there was a vast difference between the actual property rates and collector rates and the customers had to pay tax as per the collector guideline. "The consumer had to shell out more fee on buying the property against the actual cost paid for the same. The decision would remove the anomaly and help consumer pay the actual income tax on the de- MP encourages women to invest in propertyAfter 2005, there has been a sudden escalation in the property rates across the state which resulted in boom in the real estate sector. But this prompted the district authorities across the state to increase the collector guidelines to generate more revenue from the market. Unfortunately, this proved to be detrimental, resulting in a major slump in the sector, said real estate experts. Finance minister Tarun Bhanot said that the decision to increase the stamp duty on registration of property from 7.3% to 9.5% will help in curbing revenue loss to the state exchequer. He said in urban areas, buyers will have to shell out 3% extra fee like before. The state government has encouraged women to invest in property by reducing the registration fee to only Rs 100. “In case the property rates are more than the current guideline, the transfer fee would be 2.1% of the difference amount. At present, the stamp duty and registration fee on the joint-ownership of wife or daughter is 1per cent and 0.8 per cent respectively. The cabinet has slashed it to Rs 1000 as stamp duty and Rs 100 maximum as registration fee to encourage women empowerment", said Bhanot. He said in case of partition of family property, the stamp duty has been reduced to 0.5% from the current rate of 2.5%. The stamp duty and registration fee on donation of the property have also been reduced to one per cent with maximum amount of Rs 500 and Rs 100 respectively against the current rate of 2.5% and 0.8%, he said. The cabinet also decided to extend the last date of repayment of short term loan or debt drawn on zero percent interest during kharif season 2018 and rabi season 2018-19 to June 30 from June 15, said state commercial tax minister Brijendra Singh Rathore. The cabinet also discussed ways to strengthen the drug regulatory system and decided to open three food and drug labs in Indore, Jabalpur and Gwalior respectively. The cabinet gave its nod to enact Advocate Protection Act and observe December 3 as Advocate Day to mark the birth anniversary of Dr Rajendra Prasad, the first President of India. In MP, one person dies in police custody.description: BHOPAL: In a shocking piece of statistics, on an average, one person dies in police custody in every 45 days in Madhya Pradesh, reveals official records. As per a reply given in the Upper House of the Parliament, in past three years — 2015-16, 2016-17 and 2017-18 — a total of 24 cases of custodial deaths have been reported in the state. The highest cases of such deaths were reported in the year 2016-17, when 10 such incidents occurred, the reply stated. Incidentally, these figures are not included in judicial custody deaths (jail deaths), registered during the same period. The then minister of state in the Union ministry of home affairs, Hansraj Gangaram Ahir, while replying to a question by Rajya Sabha MP Vikas Mahatme had informed that a total of 384 cases of custodial deaths (judicial or in jail) were registered between 2015-16 and 2017-18 in Madhya Pradesh and in the same period a total of 24 cases of custodial deaths (police) were also reported. Thus, on an average 8 cases of custodial deaths (police) were reported every year, which in other words comes to one death getting reported every 45 days. Overall, in the entire country a total of 151 cases of custodial deaths (in police custody) were reported in 2015-16, 145 cases of custodial deaths (in police custody) were reported in year 2016-17 and in the year 2017-18, a total of 146 such deaths were reported. Thus, in three years a total of 442 cases of custodial deaths (in police custody) were reported from all over the country. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Power surplus Madhya Pradesh seeks new t.description: BHOPAL: In a bid to tackle the problem of surplus energy in the state, the Madhya Pradesh Power Management Company (MPPMC) is exploring new technologies that can be deployed for energy storage systems. Initially, officials have invited ‘expressions of interest’ from eligible experts in the field for setting up a storage system of 500MW capacity. The main objective, officials say, is to ensure effective management of surplus power on a day-to-day basis. As of now, available technologies and their viability are being explored, they add. Managing director of the MPPMC, Sukhveer Singh, says: “It is a normal phenomenon that during off-peak hours (typically evening and night hours) there is an abundance of power, but it cannot not be utilized properly, especially in the case of renewable energy. Thus, if there is a storage capacity, the energy during the off peak hours could be stored and can be used during peak hours. Even in the case of surplus power, if we sell the additional power during off peak hours — the rates at energy exchange are also lower — it could be in the financial interest of the company.” “It is a forward-looking step to ensure effective management of power. However, we are looking into the availability of suitable technologies in the field. It also depends on the proposals. We will evaluate them and take the further call,” he adds. Madhya Pradesh is energy surplus. The peak demand of power in state has been around 14,000 MW and the total contracted capacity of generation in the state is over 19,000 MW. If suitable storage facilities are developed, there could be slight improvement in the financial returns to the company, say sources. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Shiv Sena List 2019.description: MUMBAI: Shiv Sena has come up with it's first list of 21 candidates, out of 23 to contest in Lok Sabha polls in Maharashtra. Except Osmanabad, 17 sitting Sena MP's are part of the list, includes Mumbai, Thane, Kalyan, Raigad. Following complaints received by local functionaries from Osmanabad, the party has denied ticket to sitting MP Ravindra Gaikwad. Gaikwad, who had allegedly hit an Air India staffer with his slipper because he was refused a business class seat in March 2017. Maharashtra: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageSena has kept two seats, Palghar and Satara, on hold, likely to announce on Sunday. Late Chintaman Wanga, former BJP MP's son Shrinivas likely to contest from Palghar on Sena ticket whereas former NCP legislator Narendra Patil may might contest as Sena candidate from Satara. Patil met Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray on Friday at Matoshree. Other candidates are: South Mumbai: Arvind Sawant; South Central Mumbai: Rahul Shewale; Mumbai North West: Gajanan Kirtikar; Kalyan: Shrikant Shinde; Raigad: union minister Anant Gite; Osmanabad: Omraje Nimbalkar, Ratnagiri-Sindhudurg: Vinayak Raut; Kolhapur-Sanjay Mandlik; Hatkanangle: Dhairyasheel Mane; Nashik: Hemant Godse; Shirdi: Sadashiv Lokhande; Shirur: Shivajirao Adhalrao Patil; Aurangabad: Chandrakant Khaire; Yavatmal Washim: Bhawana Gawli; Buldana: Prataprao Jadhav; Ramtek: Kripal Tumane; Amrawati-Anandrao Adsul, Parbhani: Sanjay Jadhav; Maval: Shrirang Barne; Hingoli: Hemant Patil. MPHRC seeks report into custodial death.description: Bhopal: Madhya Pradesh Human Rights Commission (MPHRC) on Thursday took cognisance of the incident wherein a youth died after allegedly being beaten by police at Bairagarh police station and one other sustained injuries. Commission stated the deceased, Shivam Mishra was beaten to death inside the police station and incident was recorded in CCTV footage. The police had brought the two youths, including the one who later died, in connection with accident. Family of the boy, who died, alleged he was beaten to be looted. His gold chain, wallet and three mobile phones were missing and was allegedly looted by police. Commission has called for a report from principal secretary Home department, director general of police and DIG Bhopal within three weeks.Shivam Mishra, who died in custody, along with his friend Govind were driving down the BRTS corridor towards Khajuri at a breakneck speed on Tuesday night, when their SUV rammed into railing. They were heading to a dhaba for dinner. The collision was so severe that the airbags of the vehicle opened up and both of them sustained internal injuries.Cops reached the accident spot and rounded up both the youths though Shivam Mishra complained of severe chest pain. Instead of taking them to a hospital, cops took them to Bairagarh police station. Shivam’s friend Govind said that he pleaded with the cops to take him to a hospital but his plea fell on deaf ears. He alleged that cops even assaulted Shivam, who was almost breathless.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Jaya Prada.description: HYDERABAD: It’s been a roller coaster ride for actress Jaya Prada in politics. The actress, who started off as a Telugu film heroine dominating the scene along with Sridevi some decades ago, changed her political course on Tuesday by joining the BJP. In the last 25 years of her political career, she has changed several parties. Hailing from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh, she began her political career with the Telugu Desam Party in 1994 as she had done several films alongside TDP founderpresident N T Rama Rao. After N Chandrababu Naidu took over as chief minister, he nominated her to the Rajya Sabha and she served a term from 1996-2002. While in the TDP, Jaya Prada had a running feud with Renuka Chowdhary who was also in the TDP then. When it became clear that she was being ignored in the TDP, Jaya Prada looked for greener pastures elsewhere. The Samajwadi Party led by Mulayam Singh Yadav in Uttar Pradesh got Jaya Prada into its party fold. She contested the Rampur Lok Sabha seat from that state on the SP ticket and won in 2004. In the 2009 elections, she got re-elected from the same constituency. With differences sprouting between SP leader Amar Singh and Mulayam Singh Yadav, Jaya prada had to make a choice on who she would sail with. She preferred to join the new party that Amar Singh floated but that proved to be a futile exercise. Jaya Prada then joined the Rashtriya Janata Dal, led by Ajit Singh in UP, making the move along with Amar Singh. In the 2014 elections she was fielded as an LS candidate from Bijnor but lost. For some time, there was speculation that Jaya Prada would return to the Telugu Desam Party when she met Andhra Pradesh chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu in Amaravati in November 2015. It turned out that she had met Naidu only to invite him for her son Siddharth’s wedding that month in Hyderabad. In 2013, Jaya Prada had met Congress president Sonia Gandhi and that also led to speculation that she would join the Congress. She had even announced that she was interested in getting back to her home state and would continue her political career there. She was keen on returning to AP politics but nothing concrete materialised. On Tuesday, she was welcomed into the BJP at the party’s headquarters in Delhi. “I am working with a brave leader in whose hands India is safe,” she said about Modi.
