EOW probes Rs 400 cr-tender of Vallabh B.description: Bhopal: Madhya Pradesh state economic offences wing (EOW) has begun investigating tenders worth Rs 431-crore, floated by the former BJP government for construction of the secretariat annexe, as part of its probe into the alleged Rs 80,000 crore e-tendering scam.The annexe — named Vallabh Bhavan Extension Complex — includes a classy chamber for the chief minister, which was occupied by Kamal Nath after Congress won the last assembly election.Capital Project Administration (CPA), a wing of state housing and environment department, was the executing agency for this project. It floated tenders through Madhya Pradesh State Electronic Development Corporation (MPSEDC), whose software was allegedly manipulated by a cartel of IT professionals to benefit a few firms. The software breach forced the government to revoke nine of its major tenders floated in 2018. Probe picked up pace after Congress came to power and six people have so far been arrested.The contract for Vallabh Bhavan Extension Complex was bagged by a renowned engineering company that has executed massive projects worldwide. Notices have been issued to this company, too, as part of the investigation. Though no foul play is suspected here, it has to be probed because the software through which the tender was issued was breached, said an official.The central unit CERT-In has sent a fresh report to EOW, confirming that more e-tenders were ‘modified’ through unauthorized access in the software. “Illegal access was made in the software from hotel rooms of countries like New Zealand. Wi-Fi connections of foreign hotels were used,” said an officer.EOW had on Tuesday summoned two government officers, who were secretaries to former BJP minister Narottam Mishra, for questioning in connection with the tenders floated by water resources department in 2018. Notices were issued to Nirmal Awasthi and Virendra Pandey, who were on deputation from water resources department and law department to Mishra’s office. They will be questioned in connection with a tender awarded to Gujarat-based Sorathia Velji Ratna & Co in 2018.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Builders welcome 20% slash in Collector.description: Bhopal: State government decision to cut down the collector guideline prices by 20 per cent gave the much awaited relief to the real estate sector and the builders welcomed the decision. Kamal Nath led state government cut down the collector guideline prices of land/property by twenty per cent in the cabinet meet held on Tuesday, while increasing the stamp duty by 2 per cent from existing 7.3 per cent to 9.5 per cent in entire state and for urban areas stamp duty would be 12.5 per cent instead of existing 10.3 per cent.Spokesman, CREDAI Manoj Singh Meek said “We welcome the move. Now, there will be a positive sentiment in the sector after long time because of the government’s decision. Transaction in real estate sector had come down sharply due to over valuation of properties over the years.” We are yet to get the complete details of cabinet decision, but it will increase momentum in the real estate sector, he added.Similarly, Fortune Builders, managing director, Ajay Mohgaonkar also hailed the decision. It will lead to easing out additional burden on the sector. Real estate market would improve with the move and positive sentiment in market will help in coming up of new projects, he added.Not only builders, but also political leaders of Bhopal and other cities were opposing increase in collector guidelines rate. District evaluation committee (DEV) in Bhopal proposed to raise collector guideline prices of land/property at about 350 places in the district.MLA from Bhopal’s central constituency, Arif Masood, the only legislator in the committee, had opposed increase in collector guideline rates and when the DEV ultimately decided to recommend increase in rates at nearly 350 places in Bhopal, he allowed the proposal to go only with his dissent note last week.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Journalist Protection Act among 23 Bills.description: Bhopal: A Journalist Protection Bill is likely to be among 23 Bills scheduled to be tabled in the state assembly during Monsoon session. Once passed by the House, it would pave the way for enforcement of an Act comprising stringent laws against violence or threat of violence to a journalist.But, advocates, who are demanding implementation of an Advocate Protection Act, will have to wait a little longer as the state government is introducing a Bill seeking to create a welfare fund for lawyers during Monsoon session but not the Advocate Protection Bill. Lawyers across the state had struck work on Tuesday to highlight their demand for Advocate Protection Act.In all, Kamal Nath government is likely to introduce 23 new Bills related to 12 departments of the state government in the monsoon session, beginning July 8. The session will last for 23 days and will have 15 meetings. Four of them will replace ordinances promulgated by the state government from time to time.Among the 23 Bills likely to be tabled in the House is Appropriation Bill, 2019, MP Universities (amendment) Bill, 2019, MP Private Universities (foundation and operations) Bill, 2019 and M P Krishi Upaj Mandi (amendment) Bill, 2019.A Bill providing to raise reservation for OBCs to 27 per cent from existing 13 per cent will also be tabled in the House so as to replace the ordinance promulgated to that effect by Kamal Nath government before the general election, 2019. The state government will also introduce MP Public Health (amendment) Bill, M P Prevention of Cow Slaughter (amendment) Act, 2019 and Nanaji Deshmukh Animal Husbandry Science University (amendment) Act, 2019.The state government also proposes to introduce M P Advocates’ Welfare Fund (amendment) Bill, 2019, MP Arbitration Tribunal (amendment) Bill, 2019, Indian Penal Code (MP amendment) Bill, 2019 and Civil Procedure Code (MP amendment) Bill 2019.Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BMC hopeful of rains in a week, but read.description: BHOPAL: With barely 10 days of water remaining in the Upper Lake, water resources are running dry in the state capital. Around 17 colonies along Hoshangabad road are dealing with dry tubewells. However, the Bhopal Municipal Corporation (BMC) is optimistic that as per predictions, the monsoon will arrive in the next week and bring the much needed relief. According to BMC estimates, Upper Lake water supply can be maintained up to 1,649 feet. “Water would last till June 30. Till then, pumping of water from Upper Lake would continue,” said a BMC official. There have also been glitches in the water supply from Narmada and Kolar due to power outages. BMC would begin its ambitious drive for environmental protection and lake conservation. Under the campaign, Upper Lake's revitalization work would begin along the Bairagarh stretch of the Upper Lake. Clean-up of the catchment area is vital to water flowing into the Upper Lake. The programme was scheduled to begin from Tuesday but has been postponed for a day, according to BMC sources. Meanwhile, the BMC has a new plan to provide water to areas only connected with Upper Lake water supply. The plan was discussed with senior urban development officials. Sources said that alternate day water supply, additional water tankers and other contingencies are being worked out. It is estimated that water supply from Idgah Hills filtration plant could stop pumping water from July 1, if the Upper Lake water level does not increase by then. Around five lakh people get water from the Upper Lake. For the moment, BMC has ruled out restriction on use of water on construction and other sites. Government officials indicate that about 70,000 labourers and others could get adversely impacted in case of restrictions being introduced on water use. NCP stages protest against EVMs.description: Bhopal: The Madhya Pradesh unit of the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) on Wednesday demanded that the Electronic Voting Machines (EVM)s be discarded. Led by its state president, Raju Bhatnagar, the party held a protest outside the office of the CEO. The protesters torched an effigy of the replica of the EVMs and later handed over a memorandum to the CEO. Despite the demand of over 20 political parties to discard the EVMs, said Bhatnagar, the EC did not pay any heed to their demands. The party cited instances wherein it claimed that the functioning of EVMs can come under scanner. In the recently-concluded Lok Sabha elections, too, votes of a number of candidates in the country were same, which raises doubt on EVMs. Several countries, which had adopted the EVMs in the past have now opted for the postal ballots, the party stated its memorandum. CM Nath bats for yoga.description: Bhopal: Chief minister Kamal Nath has urged people of the state, especially youth to adopt Yoga on the eve of International Day of Yoga. Yoga gives an inspiration to follow justice and religion, Nath said. “Values like pity, compassion, friendship and peace become strong. This condition is essential for every human, whether he/she belongs to any religion, caste and community or resides in any part of the world,” said Nath. Moreover, Nath added, Yoga is not a task of a day. “It must be included in daily routine,” said Nath. He further asserted that yoga is a part of every religion. Referring to the Upanishad, he said that Yoga was called as skill for keeping control on nerves. “Yoga has been mentioned as relief from pain in Shrimad Bhagwad Gita. Yoga has been described as skill to control divergence of senses in Yoga Sutra by Maharishi Patanjali. Maharishi Arvind has even said that the entire human life is Yoga because human is a combination of many things,” said Nath. Chief Minister Natha stated, “Yoga brings peace and positive energy arouses in a peaceful heart. This energy is in the interest and welfare of all.” He mentioned that a person with cool state of mind could never take wrong decision. Educational institutions, government and private companies have also decided to organize yoga session on Friday to observe the International Yoga day. Schoolteachers in KV-1 will perform yoga on the campus. Besides, a rehearsal of students and teachers were organized at Lal Parade ground. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. H1B Visa news.description: WASHINGTON: The Trump administration has no plans to cap H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally, the state department said on Thursday. Reuters reported on Wednesday that the United States had told India it was considering restricting the H-1B visa programmes for countries with the data storage requirement. The H-1B programme issues US visas to skilled foreign workers. US mulling 15% cap on H-1B visa for Indians"The Trump Administration has no plans to place caps on H-1B work visas for nations that force foreign companies to store data locally," a state department spokeswoman said in a statement in response to the Reuters article. While an administration's "Buy American Hire American" executive order calls for a broad review of US worker visa programs, including the H-1B programme, it was not targeted at a specific country, the spokeswoman said. It is "completely separate from our ongoing discussions with India about the importance of ensuring the free flow of data across borders," the spokeswoman added. Earlier on Thursday, India said it was in talks with the United States on H-1B visas, but foreign ministry spokesman Raveesh Kumar told a news conference: "We have not heard anything officially from the US government" on capping such permits for Indians. US secretary of state Mike Pompeo is scheduled to visit New Delhi next week for talks that will include areas of disagreement between the two countries over trade. H-1B cap for India? It’s not easy and may need approval by US Congress, say expertsTwo senior Indian officials told Reuters on Wednesday they had been briefed last week on a US plan to cap the number of H-1B visas given annually to Indians at between 10% and 15% of the total number issued. There is no country-specific limit on the 85,000 H-1B work visas the United States issues every year, and an estimated 70% of them go to Indians. India Pakistan news.description: NEW DELHI/ISLAMABAD: India dismissed on Thursday as "fake news" the suggestion in Pak media that it was looking to resume talks with the hostile neighbour and asserted that there was no dilution of its position that Islamabad needed to take verifiable and irreversible action against terrorism for the dialogue to resume. Responding to Pakistan PM Imran Khan's congratulatory letter after he assumed office for the second time, PM Narendra Modi wrote back on June 12 expressing India's desire to have normal and cooperative relations with all its neighbours, including Pakistan, while stressing that "for this, it is important to build an environment of trust, free of terror, violence and hostility". Foreign minister S Jaishankar also wrote to his Pakistani counterpart S M Qureshi, again only in response to the latter's congratulatory letter, emphasising the need for an atmosphere "free from the shadow of terror and violence". The emphasis on the need for Pakistan to rein in terror as a pre-condition for re-engagement was in keeping with the stand which saw Modi refrain from engaging with Imran Khan at the just-concluded SCO summit in Kyrgyzstan. Yet, the Pakistani media chose to interpret the contents of the letters of Modi and Jaishankar as reflecting India's desire to re-engage. The foreign ministry in Delhi quickly scotched the suggestion. "There was complete distortion and an attempt to peddle fake news (in the way it was reported). The letters only reiterated India's old position that it wants normal and cooperative relations with all countries in South Asia and that it was important to create an environment free of terror and violence for it. There was no mention of any sort of dialogue with Pakistan," said MEA spokesperson Raveesh Kumar, adding that India will not be fooled by any cosmetic action against terror by Islamabad. Emphasising that both the letters were written in as per the "established diplomatic practice", Kumar said: "In their messages, they have highlighted that India seeks normal and cooperative relations with all neighbours, including Pakistan." In his letter, Modi had said that India remained committed to operationalising early an "all-year-round" Kartarpur corridor. Touching upon it, Kumar said India had already held three technical-level discussions with Pakistan and was currently awaiting clarification from Islamabad over a few issues it had raised. Puzzlingly, later in the evening, Pakistan's foreign ministry, which had kept quiet through the day, also sought to play down the speculation about the import of the letters. While responding to a question, the spokesperson said, "It was an established practice for the leadership to congratulate new office holders and for them to respond." "Pakistan's position on the way forward in relations with India was clear and well-known and did not require repetition," said the spokesperson, adding that the "vision of peace, progress and prosperity of South Asia could be advanced by peacefully resolving all outstanding disputes, including Jammu & Kashmir, and moving away from dynamic of confrontation to cooperation". Earlier in the day, sources in the Pakistan foreign office had said that Modi and Jaishankar had responded positively to recent letters from their Pakistani counterparts by conveying New Delhi's desire to engage with all countries, including Pakistan, for elimination of terrorism and prosperity of the region. "India has always prioritised peace and human development, and sought to maintain cordial relations with all regional powers," Modi and Jaishankar maintained, according to FO sources. Both leaders, according to FO sources, called for special attention on elimination of terrorism in the region and said the issue must be a core focus in all future talks. They have also appreciated sentiments from Pakistan in their letters, the FO sources added. Modi's letter was in response to a congratulatory letter from Khan in which he had underscored Pakistan's vision of working for "durable peace and stability in South Asia with peaceful resolution of all outstanding disputes, including J&K". Tejasvi Surya.description: BENGALURU: From a boy who was groomed by late Union minister H N Ananth Kumar and Tejaswini Ananth Kumar to becoming the challenge to the family’s control over Bengaluru South segment, Tejasvi Surya has come a long way.While expressing his gratitude to Kumar and his family, Surya says he is a stark example of the BJP’s intent to infuse young and new blood. You were a surprise choice for Bengaluru South. Did you expect this development?While I had feelers that there was something like this going around, I was quite happily savouring pani puri with my friends. To be honest I was overwhelmed and started tweeting about this. I only feel gratitude towards the party, which is facing a crucial election and has decided to take risk by fielding a youngster in such a prestigious seat. At 28, will you be able to fill the shoes of Kumar?Filling the shoes of Ananth Kumar is a far fetched thing for he was so gigantic. I only pray to God to give me strength, sincerity and earnestness to honestly work for the people of this constituency so that one day in the eyes of the people I can match up to Kumar’s contribution to the constituency. On lack of political experience, I have a well oiled party organisational machinery to support me with senior leaders there to hand hold me. So what is this election going to be for you?Primarily it is an election for PM Narendra Modi’s aspirational India. It is about the promise of a new and young India and I am just an ambassador of the message of this new India. It is a reflection of party and Modi’s inclination of bringing in young blood. Tejaswini not getting the ticket is quite sensitive...Yes it is sensitive but even during her talk with the Karyakartas she told them that the it was time to show maturity. She has given her full support to me. But what is your personal opinion about Tejaswini missing the ticket?When her name was first finalised by the state leadership, it must be March 11, I was the first to extend my support to her and remember posting on social media that she was the most deserving candidate and a good choice from the constituency. But the party decided to field an ordinary karyakarta like me. It is a decision taken by big people and I am just a foot soldier obeying their diktat. I have always supported Tejaswini ma’am and was literally groomed by that family. I have no reason for acrimony. Statements by Karti Chidamabaram suggest that you are the Schutzstaffel of BJP, or the infamous SS of the Nazi Germany... Your tweets also suggest that your idealogical beliefs are in conflict with the “Sab Ka Saath Sab Ka Vikas” For Karti Chidambaram and others I will reply back to them in their own coin. The idealogical inclinations are not an issue for this election. The issue for the election today, is PM Modi’s promise of a new and superpower India. My only concern as on today is to ensure that Bangalore South elects the BJP with a massive margin so that we will strengthen Modi hands. Rest is immaterial. Is age an advantage or do you require time to project yourself as a leader?That the party leadership has reposed faith in me speaks for itself and the least minimum I can do is to live up to it and say I am capable enough as on today to take on these challenges. You must rise to the occasion and I will rise to it. On dynasty politics, considering you are a nephew of a sitting BJP MLA and PM Modi has gone on the offensive against the Congress on the issue of “Naamdar”...My candidature and my role and activity in politics has no connection to my uncle’s political life. I have an identity of my own and have worked very hard over years. My aspirations precedes his elections. If the party leadership thought I was a rise to another dynast, they would not have considered me at all. Madhya Pradesh HC gives child\u2019s cus.description: BHOPAL/JABALPUR: A single-judge bench of MP high court ordered handing over children of a person, accused of killing his wife, to their paternal grandparents as desired by the child’s father, who is in jail under judicial custody. The children had been taken away by their maternal grandparents to Bihar after the alleged murder of their mother by the father. The court suggested that father being the only natural guardian of the child in the absence of mother was entitled to take a decision as to where his son should stay. Paternal grandparents, Bhramarkant Jha and his wife, residents of Anuppur district in MP, had filed a habeas corpus petition after their grand son and grand daughter, aged eight and six years respectively, were taken away by his maternal grandparents to Saharsa in Bihar after their father allegedly shot dead his wife and wife of his brother at his house in Anuppur. Now, he is in jail under judicial custody. In their habeas corpus petition, Bharamkant and his wife said that their son, Nirmal Jha, is accused of murder of his wife Pooja and wife of his brother, Archana on August 5, 2018. After his arrest, Pooja’s parents, Indra Kumar Jha and Sudha Jha, came down from Bihar and took the children with them. They said that their son wished that the children stayed with their paternal grandparents and prayed the court to handover custody of the children to them. After they were produced in the court on Tuesday, Justice Atul Sreedharan in his brief order said “pursuant to the orders passed on April 30, 2019, the children have been produced before this court by Indra Kumar Jha and Sunila Jha, who are the maternal grandparents of the children. They have been requested to handover the children to Bhramarkant Jha, who is the paternal grandfather of the children. It is relevant to state here that the father of these children, who is presently in judicial custody, had desired that his children be with his parents on the basis of which Bhramarkant Jha filed this writ petition for habeas corpus. The children had been taken away to Sahersa in Bihar by Indra Kumar Jha and Sunila Jha. But, as stated herein above, they have produced the corpus before this court. They are also handing over the custody of the corpus to the petitioners today in the presence of the court.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Bhuria, Medha may flex muscles during CM.description: Bhopal: A major show of strength between Kantilal Bhuria and Xavier Medha camps is on cards at Jhabua when chief minister Kamal Nath visits the tribal district on June 24. The chief minister will visit Jhabua to participate in a state government-sponsored mass marriage programme and to inaugurate “School Chale Hum” campaign in the state in the new academic session, but both Bhuria and Medha are likely to use the opportunity to show their strength to chief minister on the ground. Bhuria and Medha are both vying for Congress ticket from Jhabua seat in the by-election necessitated after Guman Singh Damor quit as MLA from Jhabua seat after being elected to Lok Sabha from Jhabua-Ratlam against Congress heavyweight Kantilal Bhuria. He was the only MLA given ticket by the BJP in Lok Sabha election and his win against Bhuria necessitated the by-election in Jhabua assembly election. Jhabua by-election is crucial for the Congress not only to overcome the highly demoralizing impact of rout in the recent Lok Sabha election but also to increase its numbers by one in a delicately-balanced state assembly. As of now, Congress has 114 MLAs in the House as against 108 of the BJP (after Damor’s resignation) and win at Jhabua would jack up its number to 115, only one short of absolute majority in the House. With an independent Prakash Jaiswal already a part of Kamal Nath cabinet, Congress would be far more confident of its majority in the House. Going by the results of past three assembly elections, Congress is aware that it could win the seat but only if Bhuria and Medha camps came together or at least don’t indulge in sabotage, if ticket is given to one obviously at the cost of the other. Both Bhuria and Xavier Medha have staked their claim for ticket from Jhabua and now it is for the party leadership to persuade one of them to withdraw from the fray because if both continue to demand ticket and indulge in sabotage or rebellion when any of the two is denied ticket, chances of the Congress winning its traditional seat will diminish as was the case in 2008 and 2013 election. In 2008, Bhuria’s niece Kalawati Bhuria had rebelled after Medha, the incumbent MLA, was again nominated as party candidate, contested as independent candidate and ensured Medha’s defeat. In the subsequent election in 2013, Medha paid back when he contested against official party candidate and son of Kantilal Bhuria, Vikrant Bhuria, and polled over 35000 votes to ensure Bhuria’s defeat. “Bhuria’s niece had made such a big impact in 2013 and Medha even bigger in 2018 as rebel candidate. We are sure Bhuria won’t quit the party or contest as rebel candidate but even if he stays inert, he would inflict enough damage to the party and as far as Medha is concerned, he has rebelled once and could do it again. He may even be lured by BJP, if the party doesn’t get a proper candidate”, said a senior Congress leader from the region. He also pointed out that in contrast to 2013 and 2018 election, Medha had won the 2008 election by almost 20,000 votes because there was no rebel candidate from either of the camps. Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

Nagpur BJP Candidate List.description: NAGPUR: After deadline for withdrawal for the first phase of Lok Sabha polls, 31 out of 147 candidates, whose nomination papers were found valid in seven constituencies of Vidarbha, have withdrew their papers. Now, 116 candidates are in the election fray, according chief electoral officer. Those remaining in the fray across seven constituencies are — Wardha – 14, Ramtek – 16, Nagpur – 30, Bhandara-Gondia – 14, Chandrapur – 13, Yavatmal-Washim – 24 and Gadchiroli-Chimur – 5. BJP leaders in Bhandara-Gondia are heaving a sigh of relief as two of the four rebels, Khushal Bopche and Prakash Malgave, have withdrawn from the fray after hours of persuasion by them. However, Rajendra Patle is still in the fray. Virendra Jaiswal, who resigned from BJP before nominations, is not being considered rebel as he contests every time. BJP’s Sunil Mendhe is pitted against Nana Panchbudhe of NCP here. Bopche’s rebellion had created panic in the BJP camp as he is popular in the Pawar community and in general among OBCs. In Nagpur, Abdul Karim Patel and Ravikant Meshram, withdrew on Thursday, taking the total number to three. Pallavi Nandeshwar had withdrawn on Wednesday. In Ramtek, Sachin Shende, Gajanan Jambhulkar, Prakash Tembhurne, Ranjit Saphelkar and Lalit Shamkuwar have opted out of the race. In Yavatmal-Washim and Wardha, seven and two candidates respectively withdrew on the final day. One independent candidate withdrew his nomination in Gadchiroli-Chimur constituency on Thursday. (With inputs from TO Abraham & Balwant Dhage) Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

\n46 dancers pay tributes to God through.description: A dance performance worshipping Lord Ganesh, Krishna, Ram as well as Goddesses Durga and Lakshmi was presented by artistes from a dance academy at ‘Nritya Sankeertanam’ at Bharat Bhavan.  As many as 46 students gave a synchronised Bharatnatyam performance under the guidance of Manju Mani Hatwalne. The students started with a Ganesh Vandana in Mohiniyattam, followed by a dance performance Gaiye Ganpati that highlighted the competition between Lord Ganesh and his brother Kartikeya. The other performances included Vaagheshwari Sharde, dedicated to Goddess Sharda, Bho Shambho dedicated to Mahakal and Shambho Mahadevne, a Malayalam bhajan worshipping the Natraj form of Lord Shiv. Vaishnav Janato, a famous Gujarati bhajan, was also presented in Bharatnatyam. Then a Marathi bhajan Sakha Majha depicting 10 forms of lord Vishnu and a Kannada bhajan Bhagyada Laxmi worshipping Goddess Lakshmi was also presented. The dance performances were choreographed in eight different languages. The vocals were by Vidushi Rashmi Ravi, Neela Ramkumar, Shobha Ramesh and Sheya Ravi while Virendra Kore accompanied them on flute, Mahesh Malik on the violin and Ranjini Venkatesh on the mridangam. Bhopal custodial death: A family's agony.description: BHOPAL: A pall of gloom descended on physically challenged Mishra couple after their only son Shivam's death in police custody in the wee hours of Wednesday. They accused cops of looting and murdering their 26-year-old son. Shivam's father Suresh Mishra, an ASI with cyber cell, said: "What was my child's fault? He was going to have dinner and his SUV met with an accident. He too belonged to a policeman's family but cops assaulted him mercilessly." Shivam's family members protested outside the Hamidia mortuary and refused to get his post-mortem conducted until a murder case was registered against the guilty policemen. The family reached the mortuary early morning and remained there till evening until judicial probe was ordered. Shivam's mother Sangeeta and sister Madhu silently sat beside his body and cried inconsolably. Suresh's brother Deepak Mishra is an SI in Indore. Shivam's uncle Hridyesh Bhargava denied that he was drunk at the time of the accident. He alleged that police forced alcohol in his nephew's mouth after his death to cover their crime. Shivam's aunt Soma Sharma alleged that he was whipped with police belts and had welts on his back. Shivam's friend Govind, who was with him at the time of the accident, also accused the cops of assaulting them. He said cops ignored his pleas that he had chest pain. Shivam's friend Pratap Singh Rajput said that when he met him outside Bairagarh police station after the accident, he was "fit and fine". "Then, cops took him somewhere in garb of a medical examination and misled us for two hours. We found out about his death around 4am. The medical report said Shivam was declared brought dead at 2.20am but cops hid the information from us," Pratap said. TIMELINE OF A TRAGEDY11.30 PM: Shivam picks up Govind in his SUV from Depot Square for dinner at a dhaba in Khajuri Midnight: They crash into railings on BRTS corridor near Christian Cemetery 12.20 AM: A Dial-100 FRV arrives to find a crowd of 150 already gathered 12.48 AM: Shivam and Govind taken to Bairagarh police station 1 AM: Shivam’s friend Rajput, who he had called right after accident, arrives at Bairagarh police station. Shivam tells him that cops are beating him and Govind 1.19 AM: Police take Shivam to hospital for medical examination. He has a bruise on his head and doctor says he is drunk 1.48 AM: Shivam brought back to police station; case registered against him 2.07 AM: Shivam feels restless, steps out of police station and collapses. Taken to hospital where he is declared dead (Rajput, still waiting for Shivam at police station, is told that he was taken to Hamidia and then a private hospital) 4 AM: Rajput and Govind told Shivam is in Civil Hospital, behind the police station. They find his body lying on a stretcher outside hospital 4.47 AM: Rajput informs Shivam’s family Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. Molest-Arun.description: Bhopal: A 14-year-old girl was allegedly molested by her neighbour in Kamla Nagar locality on Wednesday morning. She narrated the incident to her parents and approached police. Acting on victim’s complaint police registered a case under section of IPC and POCSO Act and started investigation. Police said that the victim is a student of class 9 and resides with family in Kamla nagar locality. She stated in her complaint that accused neighbour stalking her for past few days on the way to her college. On Wednesday morning when she was standing on his balcony around 10 am, accused allegedly started passing comments at her. Accused was pressurized her to be friend him, when she protested accused make obscene gesture and fled the spot. Police said that the accused is suspected minor and his name is withheld to protect the identity. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\u2018Need to curb rush of Everest climb.description: Bhopal: Megha Parmar, MP’s first woman to reach the Mt Everest summit, has suggested that the Nepal government should minimise the number applications for climbing the world’s highest peak. Megha was in Bhopal to attend a function at Bhojpur Club which gave her a lifetime membership of the club. Notably, this year 11 climbers have lost their lives due to heavy traffic during the summit. Talking to TOI, Megha said that it is unfortunate that this year so many people have lost their lives in their attempt to reach the summit. “Like me it is dream of every climber to complete the summit. However, it is disheartening to see that people are losing lives as traffic has increased significantly,” said Megha. Asked for the reason of such a rush, Megha said, “It is because there is no restriction. Anyone who can pay the fee with even less mountaineering experience can attempt climbing. On the other hand, China not only restricts number of applications but allows only experienced climbers to attempt the summit.” She said that more people are dying because of the lack of proper training. “Even if you have done the certificate course a good climber does lot of training under professional trainers. They put themselves under tough training situation so that they can fight exigencies,” said Megha. She said that despite so many climbers attempting the Mt Everest summit every year the awareness is poor about it. “People ask me the height which I touched at the Mt Everest. It is unfortunate that people do not know even the height of the Mt Everest which are available in several school books,” said Megha. She is willing to coach and teach if she gets an offer. “I have achieved what I wanted to. I have touched the highest peak and now my next target is to touch the lowest point of the world. However, if anyone offers me to train I will do it to motivate others,” said Megha. Incidentally, for three days after completing the summit, Sehore's Megha drifted in and out of consciousness, unable to tell anyone back home that she had achieved her dream. Later, she disclosed her journey of completing the summit. Daughter of a farmer in a landlocked state like MP, Megha always dreamt of standing on the top of the world. After a failed attempt last year, at 5am on May 22 this year she stood on the peak of Mt Everest. Megah had to turn back just 700 metres from the summit last year. Undaunted, she decided to try again. But there was another shock in store. "I had fractured my backbone in three places in a training accident in July last year. But I had promised myself that I will summit within a year, and began training again in November," she said. Her determination paid off, and she was elated to reach the summit. Then, her nightmare began. She also felt victim to the 'traffic jam' near the peak that claimed so many lives this year. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Union minister's son in police remand in.description: BHOPAL: Union minister Prahlad Patel's son Prabal and six others accused of attempted murder were produced in court on Wednesday. Police took Prabal in custody for a day; and the rest got jail remand. Police teams have fanned out to look for the other accused, including Prabal's cousin Monu, whose father Jalam Singh Patel was a minister in the BJP government. "We urged the court for remand of accused Prabal Patel for a day, which the court accepted," Narsinghpur SP Gurukaran Singh told TOI. Prabal - a first-year college student in Bhopal - was arrested on Tuesday along with six others after a clash in Narsinghpur's Gotegaon town injured five persons, including a policeman. One of those hurt has a bullet injury. Police have found that two of the injured - Himanshu Rathore (who was shot) and Rahul Rajput - used to work with the accused's group earlier but have now shifted to a rival group. "The dispute probably broke out as they wanted the duo to work for them again," the SP said. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nCM Shivraj Singh Chouhan inaugurates P.description: The three day Police Kala Mahotsav was inaugurated recently by Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan at Bharat Bhawan. The program opened with an exhibition highlighting the services rendered by the police officials in the form of paintings, poems, photographs and sculptures along with a play titled Vardiwale. A rare collection of books from the police headquarters was also kept on display for the exhibition. The collection included books from 1867 till post-independence. German box cameras invented in 1954 and paintings highlighting the tough life of police officials, made by students and artists from various states, were also on display.  Directed by Ashok Bulani and written by Vijay Shankar Mehta, Vardiwale, based on a true incident that happened in Ujjain around 20 years ago, saw mature acting and perfect dialogue delivery, thereby leaving the audiences spellbound. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nFive-day film festival 'Ekagra' commen.description: Ekagra, a five-day film festival, commenced with the film Bhuvan Shome, directed by renowned filmmaker Mrinal Sen, at Bharat Bhavan.  Made in 1969, Bhuvan Shome was one of the most appreciated films of its era. The fest will continue till July 5 and some of Hindi and Bengali cinema’s best films by Sen will be screened here.  Bhuvan Shome was a film made on a tight budget but it played a key role in establishing Sen as one of the most respectable filmmakers of that time and he won many accolades for it, including best feature film and best direction. The movie is based in the 50s where Bhuvan Shome, played by Utpal Dutt, is a strict but dedicated senior railway officer. His colleagues are always discussing his strictness but Bhuvan continues with his work without paying attention to them.  The film follows his life as he decides to go for a bird hunting holiday where he meets Gouri, a young and beautiful, easy-going girl. Bhuvan is bowled over by her and in turn, she has a great impact on his life and he lets go of his extra strict behaviour. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UAHD guidelines to curb dog menace in Ma.description: BHOPAL: MP Urban Administration and Housing Development (UAHD) has come out with new guidelines for curbing dog menace in city areas. UAHD principal secretary Sanjay Dubey, in a circular sent to all local bodies and district collectors, has instructed them to take immediate measures to curb dog menace. UAHD now aims to reduce the canine population, promote sterilization and immunization of all dogs within a span of two years. UAHD directive began with a cautionary note, in case some urban bodies go overboard with the move. UAHD has cited Preventions of Cruelty Against Animals Act, 1960 and Animal Birth Control (Dogs) Rules, 2001 and MP Human Rights Commission’s (MPHRC) directives over the issue and the reduction of man-dog conflict. MPHRC has taken note of media reports over deaths due to dog bites in Bhopal. UAHD wants to begin with a dog count in each city. Urban development notice stated that current plan to curb dog menace isn’t sufficient and ineffective and hence it wants all urban bodies to complete sterilization and immunization of dogs within two years after conducting a demographic survey. UAHD wants more dog pounds, kennel shelters within city limits to cater to dogs, which are ill or in need of proper care. In Bhopal, the district administration has already allocated land in four locations. The order focuses on having dog squads matching the population of dogs in a city. The teams should be available and able to reach on the dog bite site within a stipulated time limit. Dog population would also determine the number of vehicles each municipal body would have for the task. The establishment of Animal Birth Control Monitoring Committees at local authority levels in accordance with Animal Birth Control (Dogs) Rules is indispensable for the success of the program. The constitution of the monitoring committee is provided in Rule 4, and the functions that it is required to perform are provided in Rule 5. Besides, pre-surgical checks, dogs assessed to be incurably ill or mortally wounded shall be dealt with in the manner prescribed in Rule 9 of the Animal Birth Control (Dogs) Rules. Street dogs suspected to be rabid have to be dealt with strictly in the manner prescribed in Rule 10 of the Animal Birth Control (Dogs) Rules, 2001. To confirm rabies, the brain sample of every street dog suspected to have died of rabies must be sent to the closest accredited laboratory and a report must be obtained for every death under this category. 24X7 availability and dispensation of rabies injection has also been mandated. Bhopal: Abducted bizman jumps off moving.description: BHOPAL: A 29-year-old businessman was allegedly abducted and robbed of Rs 1.3 lakh cash by three men, who worked at his shop, in the wee hours of Wednesday in Hanumanganj. However, the victim, Salman Khan, somehow managed to escape and approached the police. Investigating Officer SI Praveen Thakre said that Khan runs a car accessories shop on Hamidia Road. He alleged that around 12.30am, he closed his shop. The accused, Salman, Sameer and Yaman, who work at his shop, misled him telling that a short-circuit had occurred inside the shop. When Khan when he went inside, the trio allegedly grabbed him from behind. When he resisted, they stifled him with a sedative-laced cloth. "They took him inside a four-wheeler. Around 3pm, when he came into his senses, he found that he was in the back seat of a car and two men were driving it towards Bhanpur area," said SI Thakre, adding that the Khan somehow managed to jump off the moving car near Chhola. BJP List 2019 Maharashtra.description: AURANGABAD/KOLHAPUR: Sitting MPs Sunil Gaikwad (Latur) and Dilip Gandhi (Ahmednagar) were denied tickets for the forthcoming Lok Sabha elections in the BJP’s first national list of candidates announced on Thursday. The list included 16 names from Maharashtra. While speculations were rife that the party would not retain Gaikwad owing to his differences with some senior BJP leaders, what came as a surprise was the ticket going to Sudhakar Shrungare, a member of the Latur zilla parishad. However, Shrungare, who is in the construction business, was the popular choice of local BJP workers. Gaikwad had won the 2014 election by a majority of over 2.5 lakh votes. Considered to be close to Union minister Nitin Gadkari, he was reportedly at loggerheads with Latur district guardian minister Sambhaji Patil-Nilangekar. The nomination of Sujay Vikhe Patil, son of senior Congress leader Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil, from Ahmednagar instead of Gandhi was a foregone conclusion ever since he joined the party last week. Sujay, a neurosurgeon by profession, will be making his entry into politics with this nomination. His late grandfather, Balasaheb Vikhe Patil, was long associated with the Congress. | Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in MaharashtraAmong other prominent leaders from Maharashtra in the first list of candidates are Union minister Nitin Gadkari from his hometown Nagpur, state BJP chief Raosaheb Danve from Jalna, Union MoS Hansraj Ahir from Chandrapur and Union MoS for defence Subash Bhamre from Dhule. Late BJP MP Gopinath Munde’s daughter, Pritam, who was elected to Parliament with a record majority after her father’s death, has been renominated from Beed. Sitting MP from Sangli Sanjay Patil has also been renominated, putting an end to speculation over any change in constituency. Patil’s candidature was opposed by a section of BJP leaders in Sangli. However, chief minister Devendra Fadnavis is understood to have called a meeting of local party leaders and resolved the differences. The party has also given tickets to Heena Gavit from Nandurbar, Raksha Khadse from Raver, Poonam Mahajan from Mumbai North Central, Kapil Patil from Bhiwandi, Sanjay Dhotre from Akola, Ramdas Tadas from Wardha, Ashok Nete from Gadchiroli and Gopal Shetty from Mumbai North. After a long wait, showers greet Bhopal.description: BHOPAL: The city woke up to a pleasant surprise on Wednesday as showers brought a much-needed relief from the searing heat. Rains also halted the northward march of mercury, with the day temperature being recorded at 31.6 degree Celsius — six notches below Tuesday’s 37.7 degrees. At 24.4 degree Celsius, the night temperature too saw a dip of two degrees. Winds blew westwards packing an average speed of 20km/hr. Weather office in Bhopal pointed towards a formation over the northern parts of the state and southern Uttar Pradesh. Small formations over the state would continue to bring respite at frequent intervals, added the met officials. Other parts of state also received showers between 8.30am and 5.30pm: Bhopal (4.8mm), Ratlam (9.4mm), Gwalior (4.6mm), Satna (3mm), Dhar (2mm), Ujjain and Guna (1mm) each, while Sagar and Indore only had a trace of rain. In Thursday’s forecast for Bhopal, the weather office predicted a partly cloudy sky and thundershowers. Day and night temperature would hover around 28 degrees and 25 degrees Celsius respectively, with winds blowing at 22km/hr. In the forecast for rest of the state, the met department has underlined a possibility of showers at Gwalior, Guna, Datia, Shivpuri, Ashok Nagar, Sheopurkalan, Morena, Bhind, Raisen, Rajgarh, Sehore, Vidisha, Rewa, Satna, Sidhi, Singrauli, Sagar, Tikamgarh, Panna, Damoh, Chhatrpur, Indore, Dhar, Khandwa, Khargone, Alirajpur, Jhabua, Barwani, Burhanpur, Ujjain, Neemuch, Ratlam, Shajapur, Dewas, Agar, Hoshangabad, Betul, Harda, Chhindwara, Jabalpur, Mandla, Balaghat, Narsinghpur, Seoni, Katni, Umaria, Anuppur, Shahdol and Dindori. As monsoon looms, open drains & waterlog.description: BHOPAL: Last July, amid heavy rains, a four-year-old was swept away in a fast-flowing drain in Panchsheel Nagar (near Link Road 3). Exactly 11months on, residents of the area continue to be apprehensive about the open drain, whose work is yet to be completed. “Nothing has changed. The approach to the liquor shop was first to be improved and the main road leading into the colony continues to be unsafe. Government is yet to complete the construction and the on-going work has made the situation worse for commuters,” said Sheela Bai, a resident of Panchsheel Nagar. Work is on-going and it would be completed within a day, claimed the Bhopal Municipal Corporation (BMC) civil engineering section official. Meanwhile, the colony and its residents continue to be apprehensive. With monsoon looming, sewage and stormwater drain issues are back to the fore. On Wednesday, BMC commissioner Vijay Datta inspected many areas in ward 53 and ward 85. In ward 53, Jatkheddi (along Hoshangabad road) Datta instructed officials to clean the drains and remove encroachments. BMC’s focus is on ensuring that that there is no waterlogging. According to BMC estimates, there are about 700 choke points in the state capital. In 2016, the BMC’s preparedness and measures were exposed in heavy rainfall. Besides, the district administration has to focus on over 957-odd structures, which have been deemed dilapidated. Over the years, after heavy rainfall, BMC elected representatives have blamed political influence and how it’s impacting on the civic efforts to clear encroachments and deal with dilapidated structures. Last year, the BMC mayor’s budget speech had listed a page full of names of locations that would benefit from Rs 125 crore stormwater drainage management projects. It comprised areas like Kechi Cholla Nallah, Krishna Nagar, Rajendra Nagar, Khushipura, Dwarka Nagar, Sanjay Nagar (near railway track) besides colonies towards BHEL and Hoshangabad road, which were the worst affected after unprecedented rainfall in June-July 2016. Many of these areas are yet to benefit from the announcement. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nPeople enjoy Bhangra themed party in B.description: Theme-based parties are one of the biggest draws for the club-hopping crowd in Bhopal and one such celebration recently drew a big crowd.  Organised at a club, this Bhangra party saw guests sporting colourful pagdis and dancing enthusiastically to rocking Punjabi beats that echoed through the pub.  As the dholwala played some peppy beats, the footloose partygoers could be seen matching their steps and performing some traditional bhangra steps. Foot-tapping music, free-flowing beverages and a lot of cheery camaraderie made the night a memorable one as the young crowd made the most of this unique theme-party. Madhya Pradesh to reconsider land titles.description: BHOPAL: Chief minister Kamal Nath on Tuesday announced that the state government will reconsider all 3.5 lakh applications of tribal families for land titles, which were rejected during the BJP regime. “During previous government’s rule, as many as 3.5 lakh applications of tribal families for land titles were rejected. The state government has ordered to reconsider all such applications,” said Nath in a statement after meeting a delegation of tribal families led by former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan at Mantralaya. The families from Budhni in Sehore district had been demanding pattas under Forest Rights Act and action against forest officials for charging them under fake cases. "The Forest Rights Act was implemented by the then UPA government. Under this, 6. 25 lakh applications seeking recognition of forest dwelling rights, were submitted during the BJP’s rule of which 3.55 lakh applications were rejected, " the CM is learnt to have said. Nath further informed that the rate of tendu leaf collection has also been increased from Rs 2,000 per standard bag to Rs 2,500, thus, ensuring the tribals a profit of Rs 500 per bag. This amount was being given to the underprivileged tendu leaf collectors through the banks, which was impractical. Now they will be paid in cash, he said. Kullu road accident.description: MANALI: At least 44 people have died and 29 sustained injured on Thursday when a bus fell into a gorge in Himachal's Kullu district. Kullu superintendent of police (SP) Shalini Agnihotri said several women and kids were among the injured. The vehicle had started its journey from the Banjar bus stand around 4pm and covered barely 2km when it met with an accident. The driver apparently lost control while negotiating a sharp turn at the Bhiyoth Mor, which has a gradient of more than 75 degrees. Eyewitnesses said the bus veered off the road to scrape the mountain face before hurtling down the gorge. Local residents and police personnel faced difficulty locating and extricating the bodies from the mangled mass of metal. Parts of the vehicle were strewn over a wide swathe of the bottom of the gorge. Between 2009 and 2018, Himachal Pradesh recorded 30,993 road accidents in which 11,561 people were killed and 53,909 injured. This year alone, as many as 430 people died in 1,168 road accidents in the state till May 31. Congress video shows former chief minist.description: BHOPAL: Congress on Tuesday released a video, which purportedly shows former chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan talking to someone (presumably some officer) and asking him to let a group of tribals enter the city “peacefully”. The group was stopped on the outskirts of the city. “Main unko lene aa rahan hun. Main Bhadbhada aa rahan huin. Yeh galat baat hai. Aap baat karo. Yadi shantipurna chahte ho to unhe aa jane do, nahin to ashanti ho jane do”. (I am coming to take them. I am coming to Bhadbhada. This is not right. You talk. If you want peace, let them come in and if you want violence, let it be so),” Chouhan is allegedly heard is saying over the phone. Commenting on the video, Congress media cell coordinator, Narendra Saluja, said: “This is Shivraj Singh Chouhan, who has been chief minister of the state for 13 years. Look at his language, how he is threatening officers … to let people come into the city with their tractor trolleys without permission. He is threatening of violence, threatening to gherao Vallabh Bhavan. He is openly challenging the law & order. He has also used ‘pitthu’ adjective for collector in the past.” Chouhan, when contacted for comments, said: “Let them circulate the videos. How does it matter? They had permission to come into the city. They have been evacuated from their habitat and were not being allowed to voice their grouse here as well. Is it democracy? They asked tribals, including small children, to park their tractor-trolleys 8-10 Km away from the place where they were permitted to assemble. Why? Don’t tribals have a right to live, to protest? Let them make videos, I have said this and would continue fighting for the poor all my life.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nChhattisgarh Mahotsav kick-started at.description: The seven day long Chhattisgarh Mahotsav recently kick-started at the Bharat Bhawan with a sculpture and painting exhibition and sitar recital among other things. The sculpture and painting exhibition highlighted the creations of 20 artists including Anant Mahamalla, Kuldeep Singh, Yogendra Tripathi, Tikendra Kumar Sahu, V Nagdas, Kishore Sahu, Deepak Verma, Rajendra Sundaria, Harish Sen, Sunita Verma, Anand Vaishnav, VV Raman (Kiran), Sheikh Hibzul, Bhanu Prakash, Ashish Kushwaha, Jhumuk Das, Sushma Agrawal, Anand Tehenguria, Yashpal Chandrakar and Hukumlal Verma. Next in line, was the sitar recital by Pandit Buddhaditya Mukherjee who played the Raag Yaman Kalyan. This was followed by energetic and mesmerizing performance of Pandavani singer Teejan Bai who began her performance with Karna Prasang. The venue was jam packed for her energetic performance. \nHistorical mela hosted for women, by w.description: A four-day long Meena Bazaar is currently on at Gohar Mahal, to the delight of women from across the city.  Dozens of women artistes from across the country are displaying products as varied as artificial jewellery, shoes, handbags, jute bags, ceramic show pieces and handlooms at the historical monument Gohar Mahal. During the era of the Nawabs, the palace used to host Meena Bazaar — the favourite spot for women to shop, and after a long time, the mela has been initiated again at Gohar Mahal.  Kutir Evam Gramudyog Minister Kusum Mehdele, who inaugurated the bazaar, told us, “It’s a good platform for female shopkeepers and buyers. This market is a one-stop place where they can enjoy shopping all the items of use. We will now organise Meena Bazaar every year here in Bhopal.”  Besides decorative items, the women seem to be most drawn towards fashion and lifestyle products here. From lac bangles to handloom fabrics such as chanderi and maheshwari as well as bagh prints, the options are aplenty. There is also a mehendi stall, offering designs in Arabian and Marwadi style for `50 and `100, respectively.  Nawabi-style glass vases and designer lamps are another highlight, which will cost you between `150-`1000. Another attraction are the wooden combs available in different shapes and sizes as well as the signature Bhopali batua (purse), costing between `250- `1000. Yogi Adityanath.description: VARANASI: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath slammed Congress president Rahul Gandhi for suddenly showing concern for the poor and asked why he didn’t ensure a minimum income scheme for them during Congress-led UPA regime when his mother Sonia Gandhi acted as ‘super prime minister’ and had a say in everything. Targeting Congress announcement of minimum income scheme for poor on coming to power, Yogi said, “Congress led UPA was in power in Centre from 2004 to 2014. Everybody knows how Rahul and his mother (Sonia Gandhi) were influential in UPA regime. However, in UPA’s 10-year regime Congress never showed the kind of sympathy for poor, unemployed, farmers and women of country like it is showing now for Pakistan.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

BJP Candidate List.description: NEW DELHI: Amid rumblings over ticket denials in some seats like Kanpur, where saffron veteran   Murli Manohar Joshi has been benched   , and Bangalore South, where the wife of late party leader Ananth Kumar was overlooked for a young debutant, BJP issued on Tuesday a list of 43 nominees for the Lok Sabha polls. Not budging in the face of Joshi’s stiff resistance to being asked to step aside, BJP announced Satyadev Pachauri, a minister in the UP cabinet, as the replacement for the octogenarian leader. The list of 30 candidates for UP, however, accommodated women and child welfare minister Maneka Gandhi and her son Varun Gandhi, who were allowed to swap their Pilibhit and Sultanpur seats. Other interesting picks include   actor-politician Jaya Prada   , who was named against SP leader Azam Khan from Rampur in UP soon after she joined BJP. The selection ignites an old and bitter rivalry, as the former Bollywood star is close to former SP leader Amar Singh who has scores to settle with SP and Khan. Another UP cabinet minister, Rita Bahuguna Joshi, a former UP Congress chief who joined BJP, will contest from the prestigious constituency of Allahabad, where the sitting party MP, Shyama Charab Gupta, has left for SP and is contesting from Banda. She is the daughter of the late H N Bahuguna, a former UP chief minister and well-known Congress leader. Law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad, the party’s candidate from Patna Sahib, faced protests when he landed in Patna on Tuesday. The protesters claimed loyalty to BJP’s Rajya Sabha MP R K Sinha, who was later pulled up by the party while sources said the heckling was led by a person identified as an expelled BJP member. Varun Gandhi, who has had his ups and downs in BJP, was on the list of nominees and will stake his claim for Pilibhit, which has been a family bastion. Maneka Gandhi will be pitted in a triangular contest against SP-BSP alliance candidate Chandrabhanu Singh, alias Sonu Singh, a local politician with clout among Rajput voters who could have turned up the heat for Varun. Rajya Sabha MP Sanjay Singh is in the fray as the Congress nominee. Joshi, a former BJP president, made no secret of his displeasure at being denied a ticket and went public by releasing a letter addressed to voters of Kanpur saying he received a call from party general secretary (organisation) Ramlal asking him not to contest the polls. Joshi, 85, has been asked not to contest just as it was decided that 91-year-old party patriarch L K Advani will not fight from Gandhinagar. Joshi’s defiant note was possibly the reason behind the nomination of a Brahmin face as another UP state minister, Satish Mahana, had been talked of as the frontrunner to replace the veteran leader The party decision is in line with several veterans not being nominated to pave way for younger leaders. The 2019 election will see the curtain drop on the electoral politics of what was seen the Vajpayee-Advani era in the party. BJP has also not given tickets to B C Khanduri, Karia Munda, Kalraj Mishra, Bijoya Chakravarty — all MPs for several terms and over 80 years of age. BJP sprang a surprise by giving 28-year-old Tejaswi Surya, an advocate and Karnataka Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha general secretary, the ticket from Bangalore South, belying expectations that Tejaswini Ananth Kumar would be its choice for the constituency her husband represented six times. The choice triggered strong protests and even state BJP president B S Yeddyurappa said they had sent only Tejaswini’s name, which, he claimed, was changed in Delhi. Tejaswini had to issue statements to mollify her supporters as she said the polls were about re-electing Narendra Modi as Prime Minister. BJP has announced 349 candidates, including 62 in UP, so far. Two seats in UP have been left for alliance partner Apna Dal (Sonelal). Party president Amit Shah will decide the remaining 16 seats in UP where sitting MPs are likely to be replaced, and a reason behind delaying the announcement is to reduce prospects of dissidence and rebellion. The party has so far dropped 14 sitting MPs in UP. BJP general secretary Arun Singh announced that Union minister Manoj Sinha has been fielded from Ghazipur, a seat he had won in 2014. BJP’s Kisan Morcha chief Birendra Singh Mast has been shifted from his sitting seat Bhadohi to far-east Ballia in UP, replacing sitting MP Bharat Singh, whose poor performance was a concern for the party. Agra MP Ram Shankar Katheria, head of the SC commission who had been denied renomination from the current seat, has been moved to Etawah (SC), replacing Ashok Kumar Dohray. UP BJP president Mahendra Nath Pandey has been repeated from Chandauli. In Video:No Murli Manohar Joshi in BJP list of 43Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Madhya Pradesh: Man thrashed, burnt aliv.description: BHOPAL: A 30-year-old man was allegedly thrashed and burnt alive by unidentified masked man near his house in Harda district. The deceased has been identified as Prakash Singh, a resident of Hanifabad area. Police said he was waylaid by the unidentified men who came on two motorcycles near his house on Wednesday morning. The accused dragged him away from his residence where they doused him with petrol and set him on fire. While the accused fled from the spot, Prakash ran towards his house in bid to save himself. Locals informed police and took him to a government hospital where he died after a few minutes. Investigators believe Prakash had a dispute with his wife after which she went to her parents’ house. Investigations are underway. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Bhopal custodial death: Govt will take a.description: BHOPAL: State home minister Bala Bachchan has said that the state government will inquire and take necessary action into the death of a youth in police custody in Bairagarh in the early hours of Wednesday. The minister also hit out at BJP leaders and said wards have turned aggressive and were taking law into their own hands and stringent action will be taken if anybody is found guilty. “Cops are investigating the death of a youth in custody in Bairagarh area. The government will take necessary action against cops if they are found to be guilty in the incident”, Bachchan told reporters at his official residence on Wednesday. The home minister also hinted stern action against those involved in attacks and other crimes. When asked about the incident in Narsinghpur, Bachchan said, “Sons of BJP leaders Prahlad Singh Patel and Kamal Patel are taking law in their hands. If someone breaks the rule of law, the government will take action. An FIR has been registered against 20 persons in the Narsinghpur incident”. Replying to allegations by former BJP minister Jalam Singh Patel that Congress government has turned revengeful against BJP leaders and registering fake cases against their family members, Bachchan said that the state government has no time for revenge politics. “Do you think that the government has time to do vendetta politics? No, we do not have time for this. But, anybody who breaks the law will have to face very stringent action”, said the minister. Meanwhile, the state BJP has attacked the Congress government for turning ‘insensitive’ towards common people. BJP national vice-president and former chief minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that police in Madhya Pradesh has turned autocratic and Congress has lost control over the police and administration. “It is extremely shameful that cops have turned autocratic and the government has lost control over the administration. The government has turned insensitive. There should be fair probes in the case related to son and nephew of Union minister Prahlad Patel”, said Chouhan. Leader of Opposition (LoP) Gopal Bhargava also condemned the death of the youth in police custody at Bairagarh. “There is no control over law and order in the state. Only mass transfers are being done by the Kamal Nath government . BJP will raise the issue of custodial death in the coming session of the Vidhan Sabha”, he said.
